greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the 8th powers of the digits of n.
comment: This is to exponent 8 as A007953 is to exponent 0, A003132 is to exponent 2, and A055013 is to exponent 4. The subsequence of primes (for n = 11, 12, 14, 21, 41, ...) begins 2, 257, 65537, 65537.
program: (MAGMA) [0] cat [&+[d^8: d in Intseq(n)]: n in [1..35]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 01 2013
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, May 10 2012
